info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued August 09 at 9:10AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 900 AM WEDNESDAY UNTIL 900 AM THURSDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...Archuleta and southern parts of Mineral and Hinsdale Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to, Piedra and Arboles. WHEN...900 AM Wednesday August 09 to 900 AM Thursday August 10 IMPACTS...The Bear Creek, Dry Lake, and Quartz Ridge wildfires will produce moderate to heavy smoke Wednesday morning for parts of Archuleta and southern portions of Mineral and Hinsdale Counties. This smoke will decrease by late Wednesday morning as atmospheric mixing increases. By Wednesday afternoon, westerly winds will transport smoke east of the fires. Most of that smoke will remain aloft and well above ground level, however brief periods of moderate to heavy smoke will be possible in parts of the San Luis Valley. By late Wednesday night, moderate to heavy smoke from the Bear Creek and Dry Lake fires will drain from Weminuche Creek in southern Hinsdale County southward into the Piedra area, and could continue down the Piedra River as far south as Arboles by early Thursday morning. Additionally, the Quartz Ridge wildfire in eastern Archuleta County could produce moderate to heavy smoke overnight for locations along East Fork Road westward to Highway 160 north of Pagosa Springs. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
